metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8749 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The volume_utils._parse_volume_info function in OpenStack Compute (Nova)before 2015.1.3 (kilo) and 12.0.x before 12.0.1 (liberty) includes theconnection_info dictionary in the StorageError message when using the Xenbackend, which might allow attackers to obtain sensitive passwordinformation by reading log files or other unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8749` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-api - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-api-ec2 - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-api-metadata - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-api-os-compute - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-api-os-volume - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-baremetal - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-cells - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-cert - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-common - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-compute - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-compute-kvm - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-compute-libvirt - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-compute-lxc - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-compute-qemu - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-compute-vmware - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-compute-xen - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-conductor - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-console - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-consoleauth - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-network - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-novncproxy - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-objectstore - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-scheduler - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-spiceproxy - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-volume - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
nova-xvpvncproxy - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
python-nova - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1.7').
